demographics.name: John Smith
demographics.supportServices: Social Work consult placed 03/25/25 for coping support.
demographics.mobility: Ambulates independently, no assistive devices needed at baseline.

diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: New onset focal seizures (left arm twitching), persistent headache unresponsive to OTC meds, subtle personality changes reported by wife.
diagnosis.emergencyPlanSeizures: Continue Levetiracetam prophylaxis, family educated on seizure first aid.
diagnosis.relevantBiomarkers: IDH-wildtype, MGMT promoter unmethylated (obtained from pathology report)
diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Maximal safe surgical resection (03/15/2025) by Dr. Robert White (Neurosurgery)

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with concurrent Temozolomide (TMZ)
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: Temozolomide 75 mg/m^2 PO Daily during radiation (Managed by Dr. Chen)
medications: Dexamethasone 2 mg PO BID (Tapering schedule planned)
Levetiracetam 750 mg PO BID (for seizure prophylaxis)

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine, Aquaplast mask fabricated and applied. Patient aligned to room lasers using anterior and bilateral marks. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point skin marks for initial alignment, then 3-point marks on thermoplastic mask aligned to room lasers. Isocenter set at L-1.5, L+2.0, V+5.0 relative to CT sim reference point.

dosimetry.constraints: Brainstem Max < 54 Gy; Chiasm Max < 54 Gy; R Optic Nrv Max < 54 Gy; L Optic Nrv Max < 54 Gy

fractions.setupNotes: CBCT match to bony anatomy, no adjustments needed.

imagingAndReports.summary: Large (4.5 cm) heterogeneously enhancing mass in R temporal lobe, suspicious for HGG.

reportDetails.fullSummary: Large (4.5 cm) heterogeneously enhancing mass in the right temporal lobe with significant surrounding vasogenic edema and mass effect, causing midline shift of 4mm. Findings suspicious for high-grade glioma.

imagingAndReports.type: MRI Brain w/ & w/o Contrast (Post-Op Day 1)
imagingAndReports.summary: Post-op changes, near-gross total resection achieved, residual enhancement noted.

reportDetails.fullSummary: Post-operative changes status-post right temporal craniotomy for tumor resection. Near-gross total resection achieved, with thin rim of residual enhancement along the posterior margin. Expected post-surgical edema.

imagingAndReports.summary: Glioblastoma, WHO Grade IV, IDH-wt, MGMT-unmethylated.
Non-contrast CT for RT planning, fused with post-op MRI.

reportDetails.fullSummary: Non-contrast CT head acquired in treatment position with thermoplastic mask immobilization for RT planning. Scan fused with post-op MRI for target delineation.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Alice Brown (Neurology)
progressNotes.summary: 54M referred for new onset seizures and HA. MRI brain shows R temporal mass concerning for HGG. Referred to Neurosurgery (Dr. White) urgently. Started Levetiracetam 500mg BID.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert White (NeuroSx)
progressNotes.summary: Pt presents with R temporal mass, likely GBM. Discussed surgical options, risks/benefits of maximal safe resection. Patient wishes to proceed. Scheduled for craniotomy 03/15. Started Dexamethasone for edema.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Robert White (NeuroSx)
progressNotes.summary: Pt underwent R temporal craniotomy, maximal safe resection of tumor. Path confirmed GBM, WHO Gr IV. Post-op course unremarkable. Plan for discharge home tomorrow. Referrals to Rad Onc (Dr. Reed) and Neuro Onc (Dr. Chen) for adjuvant therapy.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt seen post-op for R temporal GBM. Reviewed imaging, pathology (IDH-wt, MGMT-unmethylated). Discussed standard of care adjuvant chemoradiation (EBRT 60Gy/30fx w/ concurrent TMZ). Explained goals, procedure, potential side effects (fatigue, hair loss, skin reaction, cognitive effects, chemo SEs). Pt understands and agrees. Plan for CT Sim this week, start RT/TMZ ASAP. Coordinated w/ Dr. Chen.

progressNotes.author: Mark Evans, RTT
progressNotes.summary: CT Sim completed for adjuvant brain RT. Aquaplast mask fabricated, patient immobilized supine. Tolerated well. Data sent for VMAT planning.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Evelyn Reed (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient completed 5/30 fractions RT with concurrent TMZ. Tolerating reasonably well. Mild fatigue reported. No significant nausea (taking ondansetron PRN). Scalp care reviewed. CBC today shows mild decrease in Plt/WBC, acceptable to continue. Continue current plan. Follow up weekly.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant therapy to reduce risk of recurrence after surgery.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Fatigue, potential hair loss in treated area, skin redness/irritation, possible temporary worsening of neurological symptoms due to swelling, nausea/vomiting (from TMZ), lowered blood counts (from TMZ), potential long-term cognitive changes. Educated on reporting symptoms promptly.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of scalp care (gentle washing, avoid irritants), sun protection for scalp, managing fatigue (rest periods).
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT appointments, take concurrent TMZ as prescribed, attend weekly OTVs and lab draws, maintain adequate hydration and nutrition.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Take Temozolomide on empty stomach or at bedtime to minimize nausea. Take anti-nausea medication proactively if needed. Adhere to Dexamethasone taper schedule. Continue Levetiracetam consistently.

cptCharges.description: Intensity modulated radiation treatment delivery, complex (VMAT delivery)
Guidance for localization of target volume for delivery of radiation treatment (IGRT)
cptCharges.frequency: Per fraction or per week (payer dependent)
